text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to turn a mushroom and
what's a turn mushroom it's a decorative
cut I learned about thirty years ago in
culinary school it's absolutely useless
it has no practical applications other
than impressing people with your knife
skills alright
Earth Day is coming up and what better
way to celebrate than the most earthy of
all ingredients mushrooms so here's how
you do it you're gonna need some white
button mushrooms you want the really
nice fresh ones firm round alright
you're also gonna need a sharp paring
knife and then the first step here
you're gonna want to dampen the surface
of the mushroom to make those cuts
easier so I take a wet paper towel and
just rub it over the surface
this obviously also cleans it I do not
cut the stem off until it's done you
want to have as much to grab onto as you
can so the first time here I'm just
going to show you how I do it and then
we'll slow it down later alright and
then I'll try to teach you
[Music]
so that's the basic movement you're
scraping the blade against the mushroom
with one hand while you're slowly
rotating it with the other and every
time you do that it's gonna make one
kind of curved slightly angled slice
down into the mushroom so once you've
gone all the way around you're gonna be
like man that looks horrible but look as
you clean it off magically amazingly it
looks really cool all right and if you
want of course you can scrape off any
impurities with your knife and like I
said basically completely useless but
even though it really has no purpose if
you can do this people think you have
mad knife skills and you will get a
certain amount of culinary street cred
and who doesn't need more of that all
right one more time and this time I'm
actually gonna try to teach you how to
do it which is by the way impossible not
to do it to actually teach someone how
to do it all right so when you're first
learning I don't want you to try to cut
the mushroom I want you to hold the
knife like I'm holding it thumb in the
middle of the blade pressing it against
your forefinger the only thing that's
touching the mushroom on your right hand
is the fingernail of your forefinger and
I want you to just to go around making
little moves like that don't cut into
the mushroom just keep the blade flat
and with your left hand or whatever your
off hand is you're turning the mushroom
clockwise very slightly during each cut
so I want you to get that muscle memory
down go around a few times without
trying to cut and then slowly angle your
blade a little more severely and it will
start to bite into that mushroom and
it's very very exciting when it does
all right and of course you're gonna
make mushroom soup with this and you're
gonna you know practice on all 20
mushrooms that you bought for the soup
that's how you learn this so of course
you're not gonna just pick up a mushroom
and turn it perfectly the first time and
if you do it's so annoying because it
took me like six months anyway I hope
you enjoyed that little quick and fun
demo birthday's coming up and I thought
what better way to celebrate than with
mushrooms in fact many scientists
suspect mushrooms are simply the earth
shaping itself into something that looks
like food so we will eat it so anyway
head over to food wishes calm there's no
ingredients it's just a mushroom but
there'll be more info so check it out
and as always enjoy
[Music]
